attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.label: multiple
attributes.description: If `true`, the select can accept multiple values.

attributes.label: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.label: ok-text
attributes.description: The text to display on the ok button.

attributes.label: placeholder
attributes.description: The text to display when the select is empty.

attributes.label: selected-text
attributes.description: The text to display instead of the selected option's value.

attributes.label: value
attributes.description: the value of the select.

tags.label: ion-skeleton-text
tags.description: Skeleton Text is a component for rendering placeholder content. The element will render a gray block at the specified width.

attributes.label: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the skeleton text will animate.

tags.label: ion-slide
tags.description:
The Slide component is a child component of [Slides](../slides). The template
should be written as `ion-slide`. Any slide content should be written
in this component and it should be used in conjunction with [Slides](../slides).

See the [Slides API Docs](../slides) for more usage information.

tags.label: ion-slides
tags.description:
The Slides component is a multi-section container. Each section can be swiped
or dragged between. It contains any number of [Slide](../slide) components.


Adopted from Swiper.js:
The most modern mobile touch slider and framework with hardware accelerated transitions.

http://www.idangero.us/swiper/

Copyright 2016, Vladimir Kharlampidi
The iDangero.us
http://www.idangero.us/

Licensed under MIT

attributes.label: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.label: options
attributes.description:
Options to pass to the swiper instance.
See http://idangero.us/swiper/api/ for valid options

attributes.label: pager
attributes.description: If `true`, show the pagination.

attributes.label: scrollbar
attributes.description: If `true`, show the scrollbar.

tags.label: ion-spinner
tags.description:
The Spinner component provides a variety of animated SVG spinners. Spinners are visual indicators that the app is loading content or performing another process that the user needs to wait on.

The default spinner to use is based on the platform. The default spinner for `ios` is `"lines"`, and the default for `android` is `"crescent"`. If the platform is not `ios` or `android`, the spinner will default to `crescent`. If the `name` property is set, then that spinner will be used instead of the platform specific spinner.

attributes.label: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.label: duration
attributes.description: Duration of the spinner animation in milliseconds. The default varies based on the spinner.

attributes.label: name
attributes.description:
The name of the SVG spinner to use. If a name is not provided, the platform's default
spinner will be used.

attributes.label: paused
attributes.description: If `true`, the spinner's animation will be paused.

tags.label: ion-split-pane
tags.description:
SplitPane is a component that makes it possible to create multi-view layout.
Similar to iPad apps, SplitPane allows UI elements, like Menus, to be
displayed as the viewport increases.

If the devices screen size is below a certain size, the SplitPane will
collapse and the menu will become hidden again. This is especially useful when
creating an app that will be served over a browser or deployed through the app
store to phones and tablets.

attributes.label: content-id
attributes.description:
The content `id` of the split-pane's main content.
This property can be used instead of the `[main]` attribute to select the `main`
content of the split-pane.

attributes.label: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the split pane will be hidden.

attributes.label: when
attributes.description:
When the split-pane should be shown.
Can be a CSS media query expression, or a shortcut expression.
Can also be a boolean expression.

tags.label: ion-tab-bar
tags.description: The tab bar is a UI component that contains a set of [tab buttons](../tab-button). A tab bar must be provided inside of [tabs](../tabs) to communicate with each [tab](../tab).

attributes.label: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.label: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.label: selected-tab
attributes.description: The selected tab component

attributes.label: translucent
attributes.description: If `true`, the tab bar will be translucent.

tags.label: ion-tab-button
tags.description:
A tab button is a UI component that is placed inside of a [tab bar](../tab-bar). The tab button can specify the layout of the icon and label and connect to a [tab view](../tab).

See the [tabs documentation](../tabs) for more details on configuring tabs.

attributes.label: disabled
attributes.description: The selected tab component

attributes.label: href
attributes.description: The URL which will be used as the `href` within this tab's button anchor.

attributes.label: layout
attributes.description:
Set the layout of the text and icon in the tab bar.
It defaults to `'icon-top'`.

attributes.label: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.label: selected
attributes.description: The selected tab component

attributes.label: tab
attributes.description:
A tab id must be provided for each `ion-tab`. It's used internally to reference
the selected tab or by the router to switch between them.

tags.label: ion-tab
tags.description:
The tab component is a child component of [tabs](../tabs). Each tab can contain a top level navigation stack for an app or a single view. An app can have many tabs, all with their own independent navigation.

See the [tabs documentation](../tabs/) for more details on configuring tabs.

attributes.label: component
attributes.description: The component to display inside of the tab.

attributes.label: tab
attributes.description:
A tab id must be provided for each `ion-tab`. It's used internally to reference
the selected tab or by the router to switch between them.

tags.label: ion-tabs
tags.description:
Tabs are a top level navigation component to implement a tab-based navigation.
The component is a container of individual [Tab](../tab/) components.

`ion-tabs` is a styleless component that works as a router outlet in order to handle navigation.
This component does not provide any UI feedback or mechanism to switch between tabs.
In order to do so, an `ion-tab-bar` should be provided as a direct child of `ion-tabs`:

```html
<ion-tabs>
  <ion-tab tab="home">Home Content</ion-tab>
  <ion-tab tab="settings">Settings Content</ion-tab>

  <ion-tab-bar slot="bottom">

    <ion-tab-button tab="home">
      <ion-label>Home</ion-label>
      <ion-icon name="home"></ion-icon>
      <ion-badge>6</ion-badge>
    </ion-tab-button>

    <ion-tab-button tab="settings">
      <ion-label>Settings</ion-label>
      <ion-icon name="settings"></ion-icon>
    </ion-tab-button>

  </ion-tab-bar>
</ion-tabs>
```

Note that both `ion-tabs` and `ion-tab-bar` can be used as standalone elements. They don’t depend on each other to work, but they are usually used together in order to implement a tab-based navigation that feels like a native app.

`ion-tab-bar` always needs `slot="bottom"` in order to be projected into `ion-tabs` at the right place.

tags.label: ion-text
tags.description: The text component is a simple component that can be used to style the text color of any element. The `ion-text` element should wrap the element in order to change the text color of that element.

attributes.label: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.label: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

tags.label: ion-textarea
tags.description:
The textarea component is used for multi-line text input. A native textarea element is rendered inside of the component. The user experience and interactivity of the textarea component is improved by having control over the native textarea.

Unlike the native textarea element, the Ionic textarea does not support loading its value from the inner content. The textarea value should be set in the `value` attribute.

The textarea component accepts the [native textarea attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/textarea) in addition to the Ionic properties.

attributes.label: auto-grow
attributes.description: If `true`, the element height will increase based on the value.

attributes.label: autocapitalize
attributes.description: Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.

attributes.label: autofocus
attributes.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

attributes.label: clear-on-edit
attributes.description: If `true`, the value will be cleared after focus upon edit. Defaults to `true` when `type` is `"password"`, `false` for all other types.

attributes.label: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.label: cols
attributes.description: The visible width of the text control, in average character widths. If it is specified, it must be a positive integer.

attributes.label: debounce
attributes.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionChange` event after each keystroke.

attributes.label: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the textarea.

attributes.label: maxlength
attributes.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

attributes.label: minlength
attributes.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

attributes.label: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.label: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.label: placeholder
attributes.description: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

attributes.label: readonly
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

attributes.label: required
attributes.description: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

attributes.label: rows
attributes.description: The number of visible text lines for the control.

attributes.label: spellcheck
attributes.description: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

attributes.label: value
attributes.description: The value of the textarea.

attributes.label: wrap
attributes.description: Indicates how the control wraps text.

tags.label: ion-thumbnail
tags.description:
Thumbnails are square components that usually wrap an image or icon. They can be used to make it easier to display a group of larger images or provide a preview of the full-size image.

Thumbnails can be used by themselves or inside of any element. If placed inside of an `ion-item`, the thumbnail will resize to fit the parent component. To position a thumbnail on the left or right side of an item, set the slot to `start` or `end`, respectively.

tags.label: ion-title
tags.description: `ion-title` is a component that sets the title of the `Toolbar`.

attributes.label: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

tags.label: ion-toast-controller
tags.description: ToastController is a component use to create Toast components. Please see the docs for [Toast](../toast).

tags.label: ion-toast
tags.description: A Toast is a subtle notification commonly used in modern applications. It can be used to provide feedback about an operation or to display a system message. The toast appears on top of the app's content, and can be dismissed by the app to resume user interaction with the app.

attributes.label: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the toast will animate.

attributes.label: close-button-text
attributes.description: Text to display in the close button.

attributes.label: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.label: css-class
attributes.description:
Additional classes to apply for custom CSS. If multiple classes are
provided they should be separated by spaces.

attributes.label: duration
attributes.description:
How many milliseconds to wait before hiding the toast. By default, it will show
until `dismiss()` is called.

attributes.label: header
attributes.description: Header to be shown in the toast.

attributes.label: keyboard-close
attributes.description: If `true`, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

attributes.label: message
attributes.description: Message to be shown in the toast.

attributes.label: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.label: position
attributes.description: The position of the toast on the screen.

attributes.label: show-close-button
attributes.description: If `true`, the close button will be displayed.

attributes.label: translucent
attributes.description: If `true`, the toast will be translucent.

tags.label: ion-toggle
tags.description: Toggles change the state of a single option. Toggles can be switched on or off by pressing or swiping them. They can also be checked programmatically by setting the `checked` property.

attributes.label: checked
attributes.description: If `true`, the toggle is selected.

attributes.label: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.label: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the toggle.

attributes.label: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.label: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.label: value
attributes.description:
The value of the toggle does not mean if it's checked or not, use the `checked`
property for that.

The value of a toggle is analogous to the value of a `<input type="checkbox">`,
it's only used when the toggle participates in a native `<form>`.

tags.label: ion-toolbar
tags.description: Toolbars are positioned above or below content. When a toolbar is placed in an `<ion-header>` it will appear fixed at the top of the content, and when it is in an `<ion-footer>` it will appear fixed at the bottom. Fullscreen content will scroll behind a toolbar in a header or footer. When placed within an `<ion-content>`, toolbars will scroll with the content.

attributes.label: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.label: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

tags.label: ion-virtual-scroll
tags.description:
Virtual Scroll displays a virtual, "infinite" list. An array of records
is passed to the virtual scroll containing the data to create templates
for. The template created for each record, referred to as a cell, can
consist of items, headers, and footers.
For performance reasons, not every record in the list is rendered at once;
instead a small subset of records (enough to fill the viewport) are rendered
and reused as the user scrolls.

attributes.label: approx-footer-height
attributes.description:
The approximate width of each footer template's cell.
This dimension is used to help determine how many cells should
be created when initialized, and to help calculate the height of
the scrollable area. This height value can only use `px` units.
Note that the actual rendered size of each cell comes from the
app's CSS, whereas this approximation is used to help calculate
initial dimensions before the item has been rendered.

attributes.label: approx-header-height
attributes.description:
The approximate height of each header template's cell.
This dimension is used to help determine how many cells should
be created when initialized, and to help calculate the height of
the scrollable area. This height value can only use `px` units.
Note that the actual rendered size of each cell comes from the
app's CSS, whereas this approximation is used to help calculate
initial dimensions before the item has been rendered.

attributes.label: approx-item-height
attributes.description:
It is important to provide this
if virtual item height will be significantly larger than the default
The approximate height of each virtual item template's cell.
This dimension is used to help determine how many cells should
be created when initialized, and to help calculate the height of
the scrollable area. This height value can only use `px` units.
Note that the actual rendered size of each cell comes from the
app's CSS, whereas this approximation is used to help calculate
initial dimensions before the item has been rendered.
